p: The extracts from sample B (Alagoas) presented the highest contents of the analyzed compounds, being the sample that also exhibited the highest content of total phenolic compounds ( Fig 2 and Table 3). As expected, formononetin was present in significant amounts in all extracts, regardless of the geographical origin of the sample or the extraction method employed. Lopez et al. [ 11] investigated red propolis samples of different origins to identify the main chemical markers by mass spectrometry. In that study, formononetin was present at significant concentrations in 10 of the 14 investigated samples and was considered as the main marker of this type of propolis.
